SENT.plain: A 60-year-old female was admitted with complaints of severe headache, nausea, and vomiting
Computed tomography demonstrated a right cerebellar hematoma, which was surgically removed
Bilateral carotid angiography showed occlusions of the anterior and middle cerebral arteries, and abnormal vascular networks
Vertebral angiography showed a well developed posterior pericallosal artery
No cerebral vascular incident has been observed for 32 months
